Reviews.Title: “Staff and indoor pool made this a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lovey5
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel has changed its name to Comfort Suites. I guess the official change is not going to happen until the end of December 2011. Our first room was right behind the elevator /ice machine. We could hear the ice machine making a swishing sound in our room so we asked for a different room and the front desk made the change and apologized for the inconvenience. We loved the pool and the hot tub. It was easy access to I-240 and anything we wanted to do in Memphis. The continental breakfast met our needs and the staff was outstanding. The room was clean and bed was comfortable. Overall, a really nice stay and we will be using this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice quiet room close to airport”
Reviews.Author: JimmyPaducah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our honeymoon to Mexico. We just booked here since it was close to the airport, offered free shuttle to/from airport, and let us keep our car there. The place is gated and lost of lighting. (my wife was paranoid about having her car there for a week). The room was very roomy and clean. The only negative is when we returned to the states it took almost 40min to get a shuttle to pick us back up from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “the best!”
Reviews.Author: hotspringssusie
Reviews.Content: Would stay here everytime i'm in Memphis...the staff was outstanding, more like family....the room was fantastic....and breakfast superb....going back down and will be there this coming Saturday night (7/16/11) I have a family member @ St. Jude's and this Hotel is the best...so compassionate! Love you guys...look forward to seeing u soon! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Backbone great customer services”
Reviews.Author: DerekLove
Reviews.Content: Wow, from the moment my love and I walk into the hotel we rec'd breath-taking great service from the staff. This continue when we asked for much needed direction, heaven sent Director Ms. Cook arrive and assisted us with over & beyoud service. Look I travel a lot with my job & lady of mine and one thing I come not to expect everytime is great service.....Way to go American Way

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: miffie98
Reviews.Content: We often stay at Holiday Inn Express hotels but this one is the worst we have ever been to. We are Priority Club members so they upgraded us to a mini-suite with a king bed and single sofa bed for our daughter. After returning from dinner, we found out that you could NOT sit or sleep on the sofa bed. It was so bad that the cushions sunk into the bottom of the sofa. So at 10 pm we went out to our car to get an air mattress so our daughter could sleep on that instead of the sofa bed. Thanksfully we were just staying for one night. What bothered us even more was the next morning when we checked out the front desk clerk asked how things were & when I told her about the unusable sofa bed, she said that they were remodeling & had not done this room yet. Well, why would they give us, one of their Platinum Priority Club members, such a horrible room?? She didn't care on bit.........no offer to give us points, charge less, etc. Needless to say, we were very disillusioned with this Holiday Inn Express. I definitely recommend that you find a differeent place & stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: elspanko
Reviews.Content: We switched our reservation from another hotel to get an indoor pool for our daughter to swim in (thunderstorms outside). What a mistake. The staff is friendly and welcoming but the hotel is in pitiful condition. Our room smells like some kind of cleaning solvent akin to lighter fluid. The internet connection is slow and unreliable. The carpet throughout the property is old, threadbare in many places, and smells of mildew. Baseboards in our room are completely missing with torn drywall underneath. Beds are lumpy and feel over a decade old. I talked to people in the elevator who had similar conditions. From what I can tell this place stays in business because the airlines put people up here whose flights are cancelled. The tall iron fence around the property doesn't do much to lend a welcoming air, nor a sense of security since anyone can drive through the railway crossing styled entry into the parking lot. I plan to let the people at Holiday Inn know that this experience has seriously eroded their brand image with me and I suspect anyone else who has ended up here.

Reviews.Title: “Look around a little. It was okay not great.”
Reviews.Author: Mrkrmoore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Graceland and Beale Street trip. We had 2 rooms. The bathroom fans did not work in either room. Our bathroom fan had not worked in so long that there was rust around the metal door frame. I told the staff about it and they said they would contact maintance. We never heard anything back. I think there must have been mold because there was an unusual odor in our room. The kids room was not so bad. The indoor pool and gym was a nice feature and breakfast was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “I will not recommend this hotel for cust. service, area or maintenance.”
Reviews.Author: mainley1
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect a perfect hotel as hotels.com only gives it 2.5 stars. However I expect much more from the Holiday Inn brand. The lobby is nice, however the rooms need work. At first they sent us to a room that was already occupied. When that was fixed we noticed the rooms were not in good shape. The room smelled like mildew. There were missing moldings, the elevator buttons were cobbled up. I had an air mattress in the room which I leaned against the wall for daytime storage and it got wet from water seeping down the wall. Breakfast was to close at 9:30 on Saturday, but when our teens went down for breakfast at 9:15 they were removing the food which was completey gone by 9:20. There were never enough towels. When we asked for towels for the pool the staff told us they were out. But if we used the towels from our room at the pool they would not give us more towels for the shower unless we brought them our used towel. The staff was often rude. Our 19 year old went to use the workout room and was asked her age. When she told the staff she was 19 and a college sophomore they told her she could not use the facility without and adult as they did not believe she was old enough. She needed to go get ID to prove her age for the exercise room. The bathroom in the pool area had a plumbing problem and sewage was coming up from the drain. Also the light in the bathroom did not work. Rather than close the bathroom and call a plumber/electrician, they put toilet paper over the drain. The pool was dirty. You could not see the bottom. The neighborhood was quite rough. There are security gates all around the building and a gate at the entrance to the street. The only thing that kept us from changing hotels is the fact that it was a very busy weekend in Memphis and other hotels were booked.

Reviews.Title: “What a Difference a Year Makes”
Reviews.Author: TAL505
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at this Holiday Inn about 2-3 times a year. However, upon checking in this time, things were different. I checked into one room and had to move to another room because of the smell in the room and the torn sofa bed. Also, dirty socks had been left in one of the drawer. I was given another room. However the smell was terrible. I asked for something to freshen the room with. The rooms had a dam, musty smell. The bed covers were torn. The water in the pool was murky. The condition of this Holiday Inn was unbelievable. If it had not been so late, i would have checked into another hotel. I asked what had changed in this hotel in the last year, and I was told positions in management. If this hotel is to continue to carry the Holiday Inn's name, changes must be made to correct these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Not a destination spot!”
Reviews.Author: dawoz
Reviews.Content: After two canceled flights on two different airlines, the airline put us up for the night here. The hotel offered a free shuttle from the airport that was clean and air conditioned. The driver was friendly and showed up a few minutes after calling the hotel. We arrived late at night with 10 or so other passengers who had their flight canceled too. The front lobby staff did a good job in getting everyone checked into their rooms in a short amount of time. Our room was clean and the bed was typical of what you would expect from a Holiday Inn Express... Nothing fancy... Low thread count sheets. I found myself on the 4:30AM shuttle that was on time to catch a 6:00 AM flight.... the shuttle was again on time. If you are in the area and looking for a clean place to rest your head for the night, they would be just fine.... I wouldn't pay more than 70 bucks a night here though....

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have no other choice”
Reviews.Author: Jenn7037
Reviews.Content: Chose this property because I was stranded in Memphis for one night. Not entirely sure what to make of the fence around the property- I definately didn't make a solo female traveler feel safe by any means. So my first impression (fence) my have just colored my opinion from the start. Staff was very plesant. Room was adequate, although it had an off putting odor. Decor is in need of severe updating and some of the walls were badly damaged. Plus side- bathroom was spotless and the airport shuttle was quick and on time. There were plenty of other guests and famlies, so I guess the place was decent for the price, but I'm not a frequent budget hotel guest so it felt a little uncomfortable with the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Suspected Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: tboyd528
Reviews.Content: After I checked in and noticed the area (bad) and the high security fence around the property. Not usually a good sign. Another unfortuante problem was a bus load of HS kids took over the hotel with little or no supervision from parents. They wrestled, hung out in the hallway and generally made noise past midnight. For a busienss traveler, that is a problem as I need some sleep. The next morning I had a few itchy spots that I originally attributed to mosquito bites. The strange part was that all the bites were head, arm and waist, nothing below the belt line. I had 50 in all and finally called the hotel to let them know that the bites looked more like bed bugs, from photos I picked up on-line. They called back a few days later telling me that Orkin came in and claimed there was no bed bug activity. She sent me the Orkin report and it shows that the Orkin inspector spent 10 minutes in the room. That doesn't sound like enough time to thoroughly inspect a room suspected of having bed bugs. I only had slept in my own bed the eveninges previous, so the story doesn't really hold water.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable with Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: GirlFromBtown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights for a long weekend getaway. This was my first time in Memphis and I had a ball. The hotel is located in a good area for what we wanted to do; Pink Palace, Memphis Botanical Gardens, Graceland. We visited Beale Street three nights as well but the hotels downtown are very pricey so we chose not to stay there. The staff was very friendly and the free breakfast was tasty and filling - a good start to our day. I had biscuits and gravy every morning. The room was clean and looked updated. I thought the bed was very uncomfortable and didn't sleep well but my husband said it was great. The walls seemed really thin. We heard a screaming baby on one side of us one night and a couple having sex on the other side the next night. The heat kicking on and off all night long also kept me up. I was really looking forward to the hot tub but it was not working properly due to a soccer team that had been there recently and did thousands of dollars in damages to it and the fitness room. No fault of the hotel that they were still waiting on parts. We really enjoyed our visit to Memphis and when we return, will consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: TravelExpert0852
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while on business, the one plus about the location is that it is close to the airport besides that there is nothing around and a bit scary at night. The staff did all they could, they where friendly and helpful but this could just be simple southern hospitality. The hotel badly needs upgrades and like all other holiday inn express properties they are required to by years end so maybe worth giving a second shot. The hotel is best used if you have an early morning flight if not stay more toward beale street or in shady grove- there are some nice hilton properties there - an Embassy and Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately needs remodeling”
Reviews.Author: thehumps
Reviews.Content: I have not been to such a run down hotel in a long time. The carpets were so dirty looking I borrowed a pair of socks from my husband to walk around in. Some new paint and carpeting in both the rooms and halls would make a world of difference. On the plus side the bathroom was clean and the staff was friendly. The only other thing that made this stay tolerable was that we got the room free using Priority Club points.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I've had in a long while”
Reviews.Author: dan43
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. When we arrived we were greeted with warm smiles and friendly service. The beds were very comfortable and rooms were quiet. The breakfast was okay...not the greatest but just okay - it was free. The gentleman that shuttled us to the airport was very courteous and very friendly. I believe his name was 'TC'. When our trip was over we called the hotel to pick us up and they were prompt at arriving to the airport. The driver was very friendly and courteous. We do not visit Memphis that often but we do fly out of the Memphis airport frequently and I would definitely stay here again and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bigfishpj
Reviews.Content: had a nice stay at this location. room was comfortable, spacious and very clean. accessability to interstate was only minutes away and staff was helpful with directions. the staff was very friendly, especially mr. cotton, and made our small group feel like we at home.

Reviews.Title: “What the heck?”
Reviews.Author: ceonsp
Reviews.Content: Like everything around it expect this hotel to close soon. Do not go pass Democrat Road, you may not return, they lock the parking lot gates after 5pm, one evening my entry card stop working therefore I was stranded on the back parking lot. TALK ABOUT SCARY, I had to walk around to the front of the building. The bar only had few choices and the restaurant was not clean enough for me to eat there. Staff was nice, hotel is not too nasty however it is terribly dated. Holiday Inn should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with just a few issues”
Reviews.Author: DudleyDupree
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here on a business trip. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was extremely clean and comfy. Location isn't that great although it is fairly close to the airport. There are only fast food restaurants in the immediate area but not much else. I never really had a problem with noise although I keep my a/c or heat running constantly to help me sleep. I never had a chance to check out the pool or fitness areas but they appeared to be nice. My only issues would be with the location and very poor internet service. They advertise "high speed" but it's far from that. At best, it's slightly better than dialup which was frustrating for me when trying to take care of work issues online.

Reviews.Title: “would choose another location”
Reviews.Author: rfdicker
Reviews.Content: Checked in and room had peanut shells on the floor. Refrigerator did not work. Called the front desk and explained problems with room. Desk clerk was very nice and gave me another room- upgraded to a room with jacuzzi (although not sure I will use since other room was not clean...wondering if tub has been sanitized). Am uncomfortable staying at a hotel with a gated entrance. Will not stay here again when coming to Memphis for business.

Reviews.Title: “Consider yourself warned about the Shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: Richsap
Reviews.Content: The hotel location and condition is average to above average. The fact that it is surrounded by a fence and has a security system (supposedly to control drive in access and egress) I consider a plus, though it does give you the feeling of staying in a bad neighborhood. As far as I could tell, there is nothing bad about the hotel's location. True, it is not within walking distance of anything but a Waffle House, but we chose to stay there for the convenience of the "park and ride" service. And hence the reason for the lukewarm review. We arrived on a Sunday for a Monday flight out of Memphis. The shuttle service was on time, courteous and without complication. However, on the return leg of our trip we were informed (on the following Sunday evening) that the shuttle service was not available. We were instructed to take a cab from the airport and the hotel would reimburse the cab driver. As we had been out of country on a week long trip, we were pratically void of any US money, we had some foriegn currency and our wonderful Visa company had suspended out card priviledges, suspicious of all the overseas activity on our card. So we could not have paid the Cab driver ourselves, and upon hearing that he would be paid by the hotel at the hotel, the driver promptly removed our bags from his cab and put them at the curb at theh airport. You see, cab drivers to not like to be paid by third parties in Memphis. Never mind that the cab driver was one of the rudest I had ever met in my life... I'm reviewing the hotel and not the cab company. After a phone conversation between the hotel and the cab company, it was decided that they would take us to the hotel but charge the hotel a $6 "convenience charge". I didn't care, I just wanted to get my car and go home. I can only guess that we were the only guests returning to the hotel that night and the $20 cab fare was cheaper than having a shuttle driver on staff plus the vehicle expense. I just wish they would have told us of this in advance, and I would have made it a point to make sure to tuck an extra $30 or so away for cab fare. In one sentence: They broke a promise to us. On the good side, that same Sunday we arrived we incurred a flat tire. I put on the donut spare, but there is no way we could have driven the 150+ miles home on it. A very, very nice young woman behind the desk, upon hearing of our predicament regarding attempting to get a flat tire fixed on a Sunday evening, offered to have her fiance take the flat tire to be repaired and mounted on our vehicle before we returned. We of course made it fiinancially rewarding for her to do so, as this was only fair. But wait... the story gets better! Upon our return, during the same phone conversation where she informed us there was no shuttle service available, she also told us that the tire was not repairable. Her finance had taken it to several shops, and it would seem that we ran over an empty beer bottle near Beale street and it broke and punctured the sidewall. Sucks to be sure, but this young lady and her fiancee took the flat tire to a shop and had the tire replaced AT THEIR EXPENSE, not knowing if we would repay them for the purchase. We did of course, but that showed us some genuine human kindness. These people went out of their way to make sure that our return home was as hassle free as it could be, under the circumstance. So for the hotel: B- for the shuttle experience For the hotel staff: A+ for allowing true Southern hospitality to show through. I would stay there again just for that reason! Thanks Elisha!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smoke gets in your eyes”
Reviews.Author: bertha45
Reviews.Content: My room, labeled "non-smoking", was premeated by cigarette smoke through and through. It was as though a 4 pack per day smoker had been in the room 24-7 for months. It is inconceivable to me how a non-smoking room, on a non-smoking floor, and surrounded entirely by other non-smoking rooms could be this saturated with cigarette smoke. I have stayed in "smoking" rooms that had far less smoke odor than this one. In addition, the shower drain was plugged up so badly that over-the-ankle deep water pooled in the tub during a shower. I will definitely avoid this site in the future and will not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: dedjer
Reviews.Content: First thing I noticed as I drove up was that the hotel was gated. Once I entered the hotel, the lobby was very hot with no A/C. I then noticed a pamphlet describing how to protect your valuables in your car. I'm not familiar with the Memphis area, but this made me paranoid that my car was not safe in the lot. I get to my room which was very hot. Usually, when I enter a hotel room for the first time, the air is already on. Luckily there was no problems with the A/C. Unfortunately, there were problems with the exhaust vent in the bathroom. It didn't work and I called down to the front desk to ask them why it wasn't. Apparently, the front desk stated that the vent is always on. I'm not sure how that could be since the mirror would fog up completely from taking a warm shower. SIDE NOTE: I stayed at another Holiday Inn Express a week before on the outskirts of Atlanta, GA. This was the reason why I choose Holiday Inn Express when we visited Memphis. The following morning we went downstairs for our free continental breakfast. The first thing I noticed was that the food was not like the food they served in Georgia. There was no bacon, sausage, etc. I asked the server where all the meat was and he came right out and told me "We do not server meat on the weekend, it's too expensive for the hotel." At $100/night I figured I would get full service. Also, the lobby once again was sooooo HOT! I had to take my food back to the room to eat. We originally reserved the room for 2 nights, but decided to check out after the first night because the accommodations were so horrible. I'd suggest another hotel for those considering this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant for the most part”
Reviews.Author: NewMemphian
Reviews.Content: My aged mother and I stayed for 9 nights (!!!) while transitioning from NC to our new home in Memphis. Our only real complaint was that although we were in a non-smoking room and were, in theory, surrounded by other non-smoking rooms, there were times every day when cigarette smoke came into our room. I actually called and complained about it once, but all that happened was that someone from the desk came up and sprayed very perfumey air freshener which was nearly worse than the smoke for my asthmatic mother. The cleaning staff was lovely and did a good job for us. The desk staff was good too. Our only other complaint was the breakfasts. The only proteins offered were scrambled eggs that were literally crusty around the edges and sausage patties. In general, I'd grab a cup of coffee and a bagel and that would be it. I ended up going to the Kroger store down the road a ways to get food for my mother. One major issue was that the stems were cut off the bananas (the ONLY fresh fruit) so they turned mushy and brown and attracted fruit flies and germs. It was disappointing as we expected better from Holiday Inn for breakfast and that was one main reason we chose to stay there. Despite the breakfast and smoke issues, we really were comfortable there. The bed and bath linens were pristine and the beds were very comfy and getting good rest was never an issue. I'll recommend it if the occasion arises. Primarily because of the staff and the beds. I even bought a new mattress for myself based on the comfort level of the bed at this hotel. Really!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: sandybeech
Reviews.Content: My family of four planned on taking a weekend getaway to Memphis with a visit to the zoo included. We chose to stay at this particular Holiday Inn since it was newer and had an indoor pool for the kids to enjoy. We took the grandparents with us and booked two double rooms. We asked repeatedly that the rooms be adjoining since we do girls in one room, guys in the next. They of course gave us the spill, "We can't guarantee... depends on what's available at the time of check-in". We made sure to check in early 4:30pm. No adjoining rooms. When we got to the two rooms I decided I would tell them we would wait until one became available. The luggage and kids were just too much trouble with seperate rooms! Within 7 minutes of waiting in the lobby with our two young children, adjoining rooms magically became available. The bathroom had more hair on the floor than my balding uncle has left on his head! The room appearred to not have been dusted in quite awhile. It has to be glaring and obvious because I'm not much of a duster myself! On a positive note... The pool and hot tub were nice. The motel offers free breakfast. This is a very nice motel. With helpful management and clean rooms it could be a wonderful place to stay. I personally won't go to find out again though.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: GizmoWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Excpetionally clean! Stayed 2 days, Easy access to intersate. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property...With a Few Concerns”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSix
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay here for two nights, but moved to a different location after the first night. The hotel itself was newer and well maintained, but the location was a bit unsavory as they had a fence and gate around the property and a glassed-in afterhours check-in. We had dirty towels and coffee left in the pot in our room and our door wouldn't latch properly. When I told the front desk clerk why we were checking out early she was very sweet and accomodating to us and wanted to make the situation right for us. The rooms were in nice order and the beds were very comfortable. The only other problem we had was at breakfast when they were completely out of milk. It's hard to eat cereal without milk. Overall, the staff was very friendly, but we decided to move downtown Memphis and we were very glad we did. I would recommend downtown to anyone planning a trip to Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel, unreliable shuttle”
Reviews.Author: budgetingmom
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and we primarily booked it for the "park and fly" feature because of an early morning flight out of Memphis airport. We did this once before a few years ago and had a very nice experience. But things have changed at this little hotel and we weren't so happy this time around. Our room was fine and seemed pretty clean. Checking in, the front desk person was very efficient and pleasant. But the halls were very noisy and pretty well dominated by children and teenagers who literally ran up and down the hall until quite late at night. Our children were unable to swim in the indoor swimming pool, because it , too, was taken over by a large pack of unsupervised teenagers. We could hear noise from the swimming pool in our room until late at night and then the carpeting in the hallway was soaked for the rest of the night from wet guests walking back and forth to their rooms -- without drying off! The staff seemed not to notice the mess and noise. Our biggest problem was with the airport shuttle. We had phoned ahead to make sure it would be available to take us to the airport at the beginning of the week, and then pick us up to return to the hotel after our return flight a few days later. They assured us that it would be available. Well, flying out, we had no problems. The female shuttle driver was very pleasant and efficient. However, a few days later when we returned, we called the hotel to request a shuttle pickup and were told "it's busy- for the rest of the night." What?? That was the whole point of "Park and Fly"! In the end, we had to get our own transportation back to spend the night at the hotel after talking with them by phone several times. The manager was "out" and could not help us. Both mornings we ate the continental breakfast. It was basic but good: several cereals,sweetrolls, juice and milk. The little dining area was extremely hot though and was crowded with unsupervised teens and some employees who seemed to be eating their breakfast as well. Overall, this hotel is a basic, adequate place to stay if you just need a bed for the night. But be aware that the shuttle service is "iffy" and it you may have to share the common areas with some rather unpleasant fellow travelers. Next time we'll find another place to stay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Home of the Ohio State University
Reviews.Title: “Too many issues for me”
Reviews.Author: tntosu
Reviews.Content: Allow me to preface this with the fact that this hotel was picked up by my company, so it didn't cost me a plug nickle to stay here. There is nothing to gain by my educating my fellow business travellers about any of this. Additionally, I wrote two notebook pages to include with the comment card, that I had to actually ask for at the front desk, there weren't comment cards in the room or on the front desk readily available for anyone wanting one, that was left at the front desk with the gentleman that was workign at the time, in a sealed envelope with "Manager" on the front of it. So this is not the first forum that I have used to express my displeasure. I did not receive, nor did I expect to receive, any communication back from the hotel, but they had my contact info if they wanted to contact me. Check in was the first challenge. When booked, I specified a ground floor room. They had a 3rd floor room for me when I got there and only after being forced to explain my disability in front of everyone within earshot were they miraculously able to find a ground floor room to accomodate me. If your on a business trip and you don't want to work all day and then have to drive around searching for someplace to eat, find a different location to stay at. There's a Waffle chain across the street and beyond that there's nothing. You have to travel a good ways away from the hotel to even find a fast food restaurant. If you want a nice sit down dinner, I'm sure you can get directions from the front desk, but what a pain. I ate at the Waffle chain the 1st night (much better than anticipated) after I fianlly gave up driving around. After that, I ate dinner at 4-5PM over by where I was working, before going back to the hotel. The staff did a good job cleaning my room, but the complimentary coffee pack that I used the 1st night wasn't replaced, they threw my soap from the shower away and didn't replace my bathmat. I made sure the front desk knew not to charge my room for the missing bath mat, because they let you know that you're being charged for any missing items. All very minor issues, but as my title states, too many of them. If you want to use the computer access room, make sure you tell them. I just thought it must cost extra to have access to it, so I just blew it off, but while checking out I overheard another guest complaining about it and the font desk explained to him that you have to come to the front desk to get authorized. I got by without checking my email for three days, but had they shared that info with me when I checked in, it would have made things a little bit more pleasant. Why wouldn't they tell the guests that when they check in? There were as many channels on the TV that had static running through them as there were clear channels. Unfortunately, one of the channels full of static was the guide channel, so I never knew what was coming on. Don't bother telling the front desk, because sometimes the TV's just do that. Good to know, thanks. The apples they have out in the fruit basket looked good, but were like biting into and chewing on styrofoam. As far as the flavor goes, there wasn't any, so avoid the apples. Breakfast looked like it would be pretty good, and what was there was good, but they were out of quite a few items. Only one toaster? I enjoy watching the news while eating my breakfast and I sat at the table directly in front of the TV so I could hear what was going on. For some reason, the young lady that was supervising the breakfast area decided that her paper products needed inventoried during breakfast. Nevermind the fact that they are stored in the large compartment in the bottom of the TV stand that was holding the TV that I happen to be watching. So without so much as an 'excuse me" or "this will just take 5 minutes sir" or "sir, do you mind if I......", she went ahead and did whatever she was doing with the paper products, standing directly in between me and my news. Nevermind me, I'm just your guest!Overall, pretty poor continental breakfast experience. Maybe there are a lot of the things I've listed that are individually minor issues, but when you take this many minor issues and cram them into a two night stay, it makes me extremely glad that I wasn't there any longer.

Reviews.Title: “I will revisit this location again”
Reviews.Author: mccains
Reviews.Content: If you only new the half of what I went thought when I arrive at this location not due to the staff but my travel agency is to blame and Erica and Kenneth assisted me with making my stay a very exciting one after the matter was cleared up. I loved every minute of this hotel. The hotel staff name Kenneth, Erica, and Fready went above and beyond to make sure my stay was a great one. Whatever I needed I received right away from the hotel staff which included housekeeping. I don't care what anyone has said negative about this hotel it was worth the money. The bathroom were spotless the breakfast area stayed full at all times and cleaned. The staff were very concerned about you as a guest. This is one hotel that went above there job. These are the people that deserve a raise for there hard work. Whenever I am in that area again I will make Hoilday Inn and Suites on American Way in Memphis, TN my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sunny07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while going to "Memphis in May" all weekend. Rates were about $100 a night but all rooms had micro/frig/desk/coffee which was nice. Hotel appeared clean and lobby was well kept. Front desk was helpful & efficient. Pool is small but didnt really matter b/c we didnt use it. Jacuzzi avail. as well. Beds were more comfortable than your avg. hotel bed and blankets were better too. Nice shower in AM. Large showerhead. I want to buy one like it for home!! The only complaint that I have from the hotel is their transportation service. DONT use it. They say 15 min. Means 1.5 hrs. He arrives finally and StiLL wouldnt take us--said "he'd be back". It was apparent that he was up to some kind of shady business. Bottom line: Just arrange/call your own. Dont even bother with theirs or even look at their provided sheet. Cab ride is about 10 min's --$20 or so to downtown Memphis. Lots of restaurants/conveniences all nearby hotel. Area could probably be better but wasnt horrible and hotel felt secure and vehicles were gated in plus their were security cameras. Overall, It was an excellent stay! Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Curlisue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hi Express Memphis for two nights in late Dec 06. This is a quite little hotel, out of Memphis located near the aipport, however by car it is pretty quick to get into the city of Memphis. The hotel offers a continental breakfast consisting of cereal, bagels, cinnamon buns, juice, coffee & tea. When we stayed the Liberty Bowl was on and the placed was pretty busy, but the service and standard did not drop. This place is well worth the money and is close to Graceland.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: pdbabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed Here Aug 12-15 2006. Went to Memphis to take in the sights as well as Elvis week and the hotel was great. Convenient to the major interstate, rooms were spacious with a fridge (for all that left over BBQ) and microwave. Bathrooms were also spacious. Bed was comfortable as far as hotel beds go and the pillows were the best I can remember using at a hotel in recent memory. The pool was a nice size but usually crowded. Exercise room was out of service for repairs. Hot in hallways but great temperature control in rooms. The breakfast was much better than typical continental. The cinnamon buns rocked. Staff was VERY friendley. Great place to stay espcecially for the money ($73.00/night AAArate). Hope to come back soon and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: vickimp
Reviews.Content: Hotel beds were worn out and squeaked loudly when you moved. Very noisy after 12:00pm. Pool was dirty, small and smelly. Breakfast was pitiful continental (barely) with constant empty coffee pots and only one toaster. Expected a better quality holiday inn for $90.00 per night. We always stay at Holiday Inns when we travel and this one is at the bottom of the list. Employees hung outside smoking by front doors . The security guard was nice and friendly and the front desk was too busy interacting with other staff to be polite to us. Privacy lock on our room door was broken and felt unsafe. Area is very unattractive and did not seem safe. Was close to fwy though. Mgr. knocked $40 off bill for only one of our rooms because of noise level until 3:00 am and my 70 yr old mother was kept up all night. Still not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place.”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGrip
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. The hotel is very nice, clean, with a very nice staff. Hotels staff was very helpful with anything we needed. Decent free breakfast in the morning, and very nice indoor pool area. Parking area was big and well lit and fenced in. I would stay here again on my next trip to Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located just a few miles from everything Memphis has to offer, this Holiday Inn Expess is a great place to stay. It is located right on American Way in a pretty nice part of town. We did not feel unsafe at any time during our visit. The rooms were large and comfortable, and had high-speed internet access. It requires you to bring an ethernet cable. If you forget, there was a sign that said they are available at the front desk. The staff were very pleasant, and helpful. They gave us directions to anyplace we needed. Parking for us was also free, unlike some other hotels I looked into. The pool also seemed nice, but we didn't have a chance to swim. All in all, we had a great time. The hotel was a great place to stay for the money. I highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Say No”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Associates: I decided to give Holiday Inn Express a chance and I'm sorry to say, I lost. I am an Access USA member and they offered a discounted rate. I was excited by the prospect of saving money during my stay and relying on the 'Holiday Inn' name. Needless to say, the hotel experience was less than savvy. My guest and I checked in just before midnight on Friday the 24th of March. There was a large convention going on so I understood the staff's frustration as I checked in. No directions to the room where I'd be staying. No information about food services available. No thank you or have a pleasant stay. The associate handed me the card keys and moved on to the next individual. The room temperature was 90 degress according to the thermostat. Not wanted to cause difficulty, I adjusted the temperature and decided to go down to the lobby as the room cooled off. The night's sleep was fine, but the next morning had more hurdles. The coffee maker was dirty. I decided NOT to have a cup. The shower was unclean and there was mildew on the inside shower curtain. At this point I was behind schedule and did not have a moment to make the front desk aware. After all, I was receiving a discounted rate, right? Housekeeping came in and did their best, but the room just wasn't comfortable. The wall paper was peeling and the ceiling was cracking and left plaster on the desk next to the bed. There was no privacy sign, nor television directory. I know these sound like small things, but when away from home, one likes to be as comfortable as possible. Had there been a sign to use, I could have kept the housekeeper from entering my room at 9am every morning. After all was said and done, I was ready to leave, making note of the series of 'small' things that needed to be corrected. But, the hotel associate gave me one more for the road. My card, used to guarantee the reservation, had already been charged. Even if I had wanted to adjust my hotel rate (due to the inconveniences), I could not have at this point. I went on to remind the associate that I had been incorrectly billed. I was tax-exempt and gave the associate the information as I checked in. She copied the info and said that 'it was fine.' Apparently these two did not confer. The check out associate simply told me that the person who checked me in was incorrect and that I shouldn't have received the bill under my door because the room had already been paid for. I asked how and the employee went on to say that the room had been charged off already. Good thing I had money available in that account. I had every intention of using another card. The hotel housekeeping tried to make me comfortable by reminding me that they would help in any way possible, but the help that I needed required assistance from the Hotel Manager. I will definitely visit Memphis again, but I will not suggest this Holiday Inn Express location to anyone. The overall condition of the hotel was lacking, even with a full house. Overall, I feel cheated. Next time I'll gladly pay a higher rate to another business that will keep me and my level of comfort in mind. I hope that the things mentioned will be corrected so that no other guest will refrain from staying at this site.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express American Way/Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 4225 American Way, Memphis, TN 38118
